channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves and likkle berry’s from tree, 7th July
item.description:
Very slippery the round berry’s (falling from tree ) are both causeing a dangerous path in wet weather from this end , I was pushing pram and found it very dangerous , can this be cleaned , even down road leaves are very dangerous someone going hurt them self I walk this walk daily and school mum seen many accidents ,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 158, Mottingham Road, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Emergency vehicle gate open, 7th July
item.description:
The gate at the bottom of Carlisle Walk is open and it should be closed. This means cars are driving onto the estate when it is a closed roads estate - this is making the estate unsafe as people are used to the gate being closed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forest Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1st Floor neighbour hoarding food and other perishables, 7th July
item.description:
An ongoing problem at Arden hse, mounds of food is being hoarded by a neighbour then left to rot on the landing all, is attracting rodents to the building and coming it other flats. Not enough is being done to remove the rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arden Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no.129, 6th July
item.description:
Poor state of road surface has caused damage to a fixture leading to an ongoing leak onto the road. This has been a repeated problem, every time it is fixed, the road surface is relaid poorly meaning it is only a matter of time until the problem recurs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, West End Lane, Kilburn, London

item.title: Potholes and uneven surface on both sides of the road, 6th July
item.description:
Presents a trip hazard for children crossing the road to and from school at the crossing point. Humps and drain cover are in a poor state and the previous patch repair has not lasted long. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Enfield council neglect, 6th July
item.description:
Fly tips on Downes Court and Hoppers road been there for days on unswept roads, The entire borough is full of filth and rats. They are refusing to move the fly tips and targeting Winchmore Hill for non cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
